title: What did I do wrong? (I messed up my OTF)
content: Okay so i was converting a TTF to a postscript flavoured OTF on my PC using FontLab. I installed it on my Mac this morning, but none of my applications would find the font file. What did i do wrong? Any ideas?
author: pablohoney77

comments.content:
Paul -   
   
This could be any number of things.   
The most unlikely of which could be programs that   
don't recognize the file (illustrator 8) or more   
likely a naming problem.   
Adam Twardoch has a nice tutorial here:   
 [http://groups.msn.com/FontLab/tipsandtricks.msnw?action=get\_message&mview=0&ID\_Message=2843&LastModified=4675459961277512599](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121213/http:/groups.msn.com/FontLab/tipsandtricks.msnw?action=get_message&mview=0&ID_Message=2843&LastModified=4675459961277512599)

i figgered there were a host of problems that could be possibilities and that i had just asked a stupid question and so no one wanted to acknowledge it. But thanks for your help Eric... hopefully i can figger this out!

Also, it would help to know:   
   
What Mac OS version you're using   
What version of ATM (if any)   
How you installed the fonts   
What applications you tried it in   
   
T

I'm Running OS 9.2.1 and ATM 4.6   
I installed the font simply by dragging it onto the system folder and dropping it there, and then clicked 'OK' when i was prompeted to place the file in the fonts folder.   
I then tried to use the font in Photoshop 6, InDesign 2, Illustrator 9, and MultiAd 2 v1.6.2, oh and Word for Mac and the font didn't show up in the font list in any of these programs.   
I tried just doubleclicking on the OTF icon and got the message i usually get when i do the same to a PC TTF - "The font cannot be opened because there is no sample provided" but i don't know whether this is unusual for OTF fonts or not.   
I'm afraid i need to walk through the exporting process from start to finish, but the problem is i don't know where the start is!!! any helpful ideas/information on this would be much appreciated. thanks again for listening.

okay, i'm reading now on my fonts ( [http://www.myfonts.com/info/opentype-support-in-applications/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526121213/http:/www.myfonts.com/info/opentype-support-in-applications/)) that I need ATM 4.6.2 to have open type PS support, maybe that's my problem, eh? i'll give it a whirl...   
oh wait, but those House Industries OTF fonts worked just fine on my workstation... so maybe it's still something else...

Okay, so i followed Adam's naming conventions and that solved all my problems, Thnx Eric! Thnx Thom! Maybe the fact that i completely skipped over the OT naming before was my problem, haha. Anyway thnx again!
